intro: Melpomene gracilis, commonly known as the slender mallow, is a flowering plant native to South America. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton. The plant features slender stems and heart-shaped leaves with a velvety texture. Its flowers are typically pink or red, with five petals and a prominent central stigma. Melpomene gracilis is often grown as an ornamental plant for its attractive foliage and showy blooms.
